Name: Operation of gas-fired low-pressure boilers.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the operation of gas-fired low-pressure boilers

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Fire and Emergency Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Fire and Emergency Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: October 17, 2019 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - October 17, 2019

Summary: This bill would require any gas-fired low-pressure boiler that is not fully automatic to be operated by, or under the supervision of, a person who holds a certificate of fitness issued by the Fire Commissioner.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Subdivision (a) of section 27-797 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
      (a) Every oil burning installation that is not fully automatic or requires preheating and every gas-fired low-pressure boiler that is not fully automatic shall be operated by, or under, the direct supervision of a person holding a certificate of fitness issued by the fire commissioner. Such person shall be in the building at all times while the burners are in operation, and shall be present in the boiler room during the starting of the operation of a boiler.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 60 days after it becomes law.
